title: Officer Who Shot Jacob Blake Won’t Face Civil-Rights Charges, DOJ Says
sub_head: Shooting in August 2020 sparked weeks of violent unrest in small city south of Milwaukee
body:
The Justice Department won’t bring federal civil-rights charges against a police officer whose shooting of Jacob Blake in Kenosha, Wis., in August 2020 sparked weeks of violent unrest in the small city south of Milwaukee.
Officials said Friday that federal prosecutors had found insufficient evidence to prove that the officer, Rusten Sheskey, who is white, willfully used excessive force when he shot Mr. Blake, who is Black, seven times, leaving him paralyzed from the waist down.
